html.p: Given vectors [mathjaxinline]v_1, v_2, \ldots v_ n[/mathjaxinline] in a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] over a field [mathjaxinline]F[/mathjaxinline], we define the span of [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2; \ldots v_ n\}[/mathjaxinline] to be the set of all linear combinations of [mathjaxinline]v_1, v_2, \ldots v_ n[/mathjaxinline]. In other words,

tr.td: [mathjax]\mathrm{Span}\{ v_1; v_2; \ldots v_ n\} = \{ a_1 v_1 + a_2 v_2 + \ldots + a_ nv_ n : a_ i \in F \} .[/mathjax]

html.p: The span of a list with zero vectors is defined to be [mathjaxinline]\{ \mathbf{0}\}[/mathjaxinline].
